attributes.name: Ember.TrackedArray
attributes.description: An Ember.TrackedArray tracks array operations. It's useful when you want to lazily compute the indexes of items in an array after they've been shifted by subsequent operations.

params.name: items
params.description:
The array to be tracked.  This is used just to get
the initial items for the starting state of retain:n.

methods.description: Track that newItems were added to the tracked array at index.
methods.name: addItems

methods.description:
Apply all operations, reducing them to retain:n, for n, the number of items in the array.

callback will be called for each operation and will be passed the following arguments:

  • {array} items The items for the given operation
  • {number} offset The computed offset of the items, ie the index in the array of the first item for this operation.
  • {string} operation The type of the operation. One of Ember.TrackedArray.{RETAIN, DELETE, INSERT}
methods.name: apply

methods.description: Return an ArrayOperationMatch for the operation that contains the item at index.
methods.name: _findArrayOperation

params.name: index
params.description:
the index of the item whose operation information
should be returned.

methods.description: Internal data structure to represent an array operation.
methods.name: ArrayOperation

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of the operation.  One of
`Ember.TrackedArray.{RETAIN, INSERT, DELETE}`

params.name: count
params.description: The number of items in this operation.

params.name: items
params.description:
The items of the operation, if included.  RETAIN and
INSERT include their items, DELETE does not.

methods.description: Internal data structure used to include information when looking up operations by item index.
methods.name: ArrayOperationMatch

params.name: index
params.description: The index of `operation` in the array of operations.

params.name: split
params.description:
Whether or not the item index searched for would
require a split for a new operation type.

params.name: rangeStart
params.description:
The index of the first item in the operation,
with respect to the tracked array.  The index of the last item can be computed
from `rangeStart` and `operation.count`.
